title: About
text:
Education
Johns Hopkins University (2024-present)
ScM in Biostatistics
University of Toronto (2019-2024)
BS in Statistics and Human Biology: Health and Disease


Research experience

Precision medicine clinical trial design in psychiatry (2023.9-2024.8)
Meta-analysis of Alzheimer’s disease human and mouse single-cell transcriptome (2023.9-2024.4)
Role of miR-193b-5p in attenuating influenza-induced ARDS (2022.4-2024.9)
Influence of diet and macronutrient intake on the structure and function of gut microbiota in wild primate group (2021.6-2021.7)



Personal interest
Outside of my studies, I enjoy a variety of hobbies, including exploring food in the city, watching anime, practicing archery, playing video games, and dancing.

title: Xiao Wu
text: I am a first-year ScM student in biostatistics at Johns Hopkins Bloomberg School of Public Health. After I completed a Bacholar’s degree in human biology and statistics, I find myself interested in causal inference research and clinical trial design.
